de.lambeck.pned.models.data.validation

Class EnabledTransitionsValidator

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.lambeck.pned.models.data.validation.AbstractValidator
      • de.lambeck.pned.models.data.validation.EnabledTransitionsValidator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IValidator

    public class EnabledTransitionsValidator
extends AbstractValidator
    Checks which transitions are enabled or not and detects unsafe transitions. To be used in combination with the ValidationController.
    Author:
    Thomas Lambeck, 4128320

      private void removeExistingEnabledStates()
      Removes the "enabled" state from all IGuiTransition to avoid wrong GUI display (before we check whether to quit if the model is invalid!).
      private void reportEndMarkingReached()
      Reports the regular end marking (both: to the validation controller and to the user).
      private void reportValidationDeadlock()
      Adds a critical message for a deadlock.
      private void reportValidationFirstTokenOnEndPlace()
      Adds a warning message for tokens that cannot reach the end place because the end place already has a token.
      private void reportValidationNoTransitionsFound()
      Adds an info message for a model without transitions.
      private void reportValidationTokenOnEndPlaceFailed()
      Adds a critical message to indicate that the token count on the end place could not be checked and the validation has stopped.

      Adds a warning message for a model with an unsafe transition.

      Shows a modal message box for the regular end marking.

        private boolean isTokenOnEndPlace()
                           throws java.util.NoSuchElementException
        Checks whether there is a token on the end place or not.
        Returns:
        True = token on end place, false = no token on end place
        Throws:
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - If end place was not found

      • getEnabledDataTransitionsCount

        private int getEnabledDataTransitionsCount()
        Invokes the checkEnabled() method on all transitions in the IDataModel and returns the counter of "enabled" states.
        Returns:
        The number of enabled transitions, -1 if this model does not contain transitions

      • checkAbortCondition1

        private boolean checkAbortCondition1()
        Checks abort condition 1: Model already classified as invalid?
        Returns:
        true = result is critical, false = result is not critical

        private void reportValidationTokenOnEndPlaceFailed()

        Determines the unambiguous end place of the Petri net.
        Parameters:
        dataPlaces - The List of DataPlace in this IDataModel
        Returns:
